Authors: Purnomo A., Septianto A., Sutiksno D.U., Hikmawan M.I., Kumalasari R.D.
Title: Technopreneur publication: A bibliometric analysis (2000-2019)
Source title: Proceedings of 2020 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2020
Affiliations: BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Universitas Nahdlatul Ulama Sidoarjo, Chemical Engineering Department, Sidoarjo, Indonesia; Politeknik Negeri Ambon, Business Administration Department, Ambon, Indonesia; Universitas Muhammadiyah Prof.Dr.Hamka, Pharmaceutical Department, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Purnomo, A., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Septianto, A., Universitas Nahdlatul Ulama Sidoarjo, Chemical Engineering Department, Sidoarjo, Indonesia; Sutiksno, D.U., Politeknik Negeri Ambon, Business Administration Department, Ambon, Indonesia; Hikmawan, M.I., Universitas Muhammadiyah Prof.Dr.Hamka, Pharmaceutical Department, Jakarta, Indonesia; Kumalasari, R.D., BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University, Entrepreneurship Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Technopreneur is formation of entrepreneur that involve technology. It has been research yet the notion about technopreneur publication which showed the big picture using data from all countries. This study aims to map scientific publications in the field of technopreneur visually at the global level indexed by Scopus using Bibliometric analysis. This study was used the analysis features of Scopus applications and visualizes bibliometric networks using VOSviewer. This study adds keywords related to technopreneur in the Scopus database with 38 academic documents published from 2000 to 2019 at the global level. Based on this study, patterns and trends has been found in increasing numbers of international publications in the field of technopreneur indexed by Scopus. The most productive countries, research institution, and authors in the field of technopreneur publications are Malaysia, Nanyang University of Technology, and Abdullah, S.H. There were one collaborative network of researchers related to the technopreneur publication. The most intensive subject area and types of documents were social science and articles. This research proposes a convergence axis classification consisting of technopreneur publication to characterize the body of knowledge generated from two decades of publication: Entrepreneurship, Information technology, Knowledge management, and Education, abbreviated as EIKE themes. © 2020 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Classification (of information); Knowledge management; Bibliometric; Bibliometric analysis; Body of knowledge; Collaborative network; Malaysia; Research institutions; Scientific publications; Scopus database; Publishing

Authors: Lukiyanto K., Widita A., Kumalasari R.D.
Title: Patron-client relationship in microenterprise development as a cultural heritage in modern era
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Entrepreneurship Program, Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Malang, 65126, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lukiyanto, K., Entrepreneurship Program, Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Widita, A., Entrepreneurship Program, Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Malang, 65126, Indonesia; Kumalasari, R.D., Entrepreneurship Program, Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Malang, 65126, Indonesia
Abstract: The development of small and medium enterprises has become the Indonesian government’s priority to strengthen the national economy. Traditional society is a group which needs special attention since not all government’s development programmes can be implemented and are suitable. Traditional society has its own experience in developing business such as the patron-client relationship. The patron-client relationship is one of the existing cultural heritages. Amidst views which considers the relationship exploitative, the pattern is still spreading in traditional society. This study shows that patron-client relationship is the best choice for traditional society since it does not erase their culture. In fact, it helps to develop and protect culture amid today’s modernity. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Culture; Development programmes; Microenterprise; Patron client; Traditional society
References: Auyero, J., Lapegna, P., Poma, F.P., Patronage politics and contentious collective action: A recursive relationship (2009) Latin American Politics and Society, 51 (1), pp. 1-31; Boissevain, J., Patronage in Sicily (1966) The Anthropology of Europe, , Berg: Oxford; Breman, J., Wiradi, (2004) Masa Cerah Dan Masa Suram Di Pedesaan Jawa: Studi Kasus Dinamika Sosio-Ekonomi Di Dua Desa Menjelang Akhir Abad Ke-20, , Jakarta: LP3ES; Caesar, L.A.Y., Performance excellence by transformational leadership in developing collectivistic culture for Indonesian companies (2016) Pertanika Journal of Social Science and Humanities, 24 (S), pp. 19-32; Damsar, (1997) Sosiologi Ekonomi, , Jakarta: Bumi Aksara; De Wit, J., Berner, E., Progressive patronage? Authors: Simarmata J., Limbong T., Tambunan A.R.S., Simanjuntak M.P., Limbong R., Purnomo A., Kumalasari R.D., Anam F., Khoifulloh K., Nisa K., Aryni Y., Purba O.N., Sianturi F.A., Tarigan P., Napitupulu E.
Title: Multimedia of number recognition for early childhood using image object
Source title: International Journal of Engineering and Technology(UAE)
Affiliations: Universitas Negeri Medan, Medan, Indonesia; Universitas Katolik Santo Thomas, Medan, Indonesia; STMIK Budi Darma, Medan, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology Malang, Malang, Indonesia; Universitas Wijaya Kusuma Surabaya, Surabaya, Indonesia; MAN Sidoarjo, Sidoarjo, Indonesia; Universitas Asahan, Kisaran, Indonesia; STMIK Pelita Nusantara, Medan, Indonesia; STMIK Kristen NEUMANN, Medan, Indonesia

Abstract: Many children are currently challenging to comprehend the mathematics learning, especially the counting. The children assumed that mathematics is a disliked subject, while most of the aspects in the daily life require the ability to count. The primary education about the numbers is still lacking. In early childhood, a math learning activity should be in a fun atmosphere in learning. To know numbers need to be presented creatively by using media such as multimedia-based computers so as not to get bored for the students. The application of number recognition for early childhood is equipped with sound to assist the students in pronouncing the numbers. By using the computer, the students can recognize the number 1 to 10 increased by about 37%, 39% of the students can write the numbers, and 15% of them can say the numbers. © 2018 Authors.
Author Keywords: Early chilhood; Image object; Multimedia; Number recognition
